meanings.definition: A low, continuous humming or murmuring sound
meanings.sent1: The buzz of the bees filled the garden with a soothing sound.
meanings.sent2: I heard a buzz coming from the old refrigerator.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was so quiet that even a tiny buzz from a fly could be heard.
meanings.sent4: The buzz of the distant traffic reminded me of the city's constant movement.
meanings.sent5: The buzz of the fan overhead helped me relax and fall asleep.

meanings.definition: A feeling of excitement or energy
meanings.sent1: The buzz of anticipation before the concert was palpable.
meanings.sent2: There was a buzz in the air as the team prepared for the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The buzz of the crowd at the game made me even more excited to be there.
meanings.sent4: The buzz of energy in the room was contagious, and I couldn't help but join in.
meanings.sent5: The buzz of excitement in the room was electric, making everyone smile.

meanings.definition: To make a low, continuous humming sound
meanings.sent1: The bees buzzed around the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the old refrigerator buzzing in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The old car would always buzz loudly when starting up.
meanings.sent4: The phone continued to buzz with notifications throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The cicadas buzzed in the trees, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The bees buzzed from flower to flower in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I saw the busy worker bees buzzing around the hive.
meanings.sent3: The children would buzz around the playground during recess.
meanings.sent4: The delivery trucks would buzz in and out of the warehouse all day.
meanings.sent5: The students would buzz around the classroom, eager to start the experiment.

meanings.sent1: The group of friends would buzz about the latest gossip in town.
meanings.sent2: I overheard my coworkers buzzing about the upcoming office party.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors would buzz about the new family moving in next door.
meanings.sent4: The students would buzz with excitement about the upcoming field trip.
meanings.sent5: The fans would buzz with anticipation before the start of the concert.

meanings.definition: To be filled with a buzzing sound
meanings.sent1: The room buzzed with the sound of conversation during the party.
meanings.sent2: The garden buzzed with the sound of bees collecting nectar.
meanings.sent3: The stadium would buzz with excitement during the final moments of the game.
meanings.sent4: The city streets would buzz with activity during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The forest would buzz with life as the sun began to rise.
